intro: Leptodactylon pungens subsp. brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leptodactylon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically less than 5 cm in length. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in moist, shaded environments. This subspecies is often found in rocky or wooded areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
